NAME: Aayushi Vatsyayan
ABOUT: Experienced Engineer with a demonstrated history of working in the wireless industry. Skilled in Networking, Altera Quartus, Embedded C, and Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP). Strong engineering professional with a Master of Engineering (M.Eng.) focused in Embedded System from University of Colorado Boulder.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Designed and implement a model to manage email messages using classification methods. Implemented on enron data set. Did feature engineering and tested accuracy of different algorithms like Multinomial NB, SVM, KNN.
Implemented AdaBoost classification framework to take a drawing of a number and predict what number it corresponds to.
Implemented a stochastic gradient ascent with Lazy Sparse Regularization for logistic regression and applied it to the task of determining whether documents are talking about hockey or baseball.
Designed a bootloader for ARM based freescale board that can erase the existing code and burn new code into its flash memory.

Designed counter, state machines, ALU, FIFO, adder, multiplier in Verilog and VHDL and analyzed timing constraints in Quartus/Libero/Xilinx (MAX10, Microsemi SmartFusion, Cyclone V, Xilinx PYNQ).
Altera MAX 10 Board:Implemented a PWM generator and finger temperature sensor (Verilog) on board and displayed its relative intensity using LEDs. 
Designed a system in Qsys having NIOS II Soft core processor interfaced with different peripherals and implemented it on board.
Microsemi SmartFusion Board: Designed an Embedded System (Memory, Clock Management, Interrupt Handling, UART interface) using hardcore ARM Cortex processor and implemented it on board. 
Altera Cyclone-V DE1 SoC: Implemented Real Time Clock, Morse Code (using Verilog and assembly language) and learn interfacing of ARM HPS and FPGA
Designed a working model of Intelligent Train Engine to illustrate the automatic control of engine's speed signaled by colored light

Did design, analysis and measurement of interconnects for high speed digital, high speed serial · links, including transmission lines, vias, connectors; measurements using scopes, VNA and TDR instruments. 
Designed and analyzed 10Gbps differential strip-line channel and study the effect of various design parameters on the eye diagram. Analyzed the effect of losses and reflections on jitter and came up with design guidelines to achieve an open eye
Designed a cache simulator that simulated a cache with provided parameters like cache size, block size, associativity, write through/back policy and recorded cache read/write, hit/miss.

Designed a system that will translate the sign language into speech. It is basically a glove and a microcontroller based system. Glove can detect almost all the gestures of a hand and microcontroller based system converts some specified gestures into human recognizable voice.

During Internship at A-Tec Chandigarh (June '11) in Embedded System Designing, Designed a RF based remote controlled Robot using ASK (Amplitude Shift Keying) based Tx/Rx (transmitter/receiver) pair operating at 433MHz.

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Distributed File System using Network Programming
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Developed a client/server-based application that allows client to store and retrieve files on multiple servers.

Hosted an HTTP based web server in C(Linux) using socket programming which supports different file formats and serves multiple client request simultaneously. Features include handling multiple connections using fork, error handling and pipelining.
Designed a simulator, that simulated four stage pipeline of microprocessor using multi-threaded coding (OPENMP and MPI)

HONOR & AWARD.Title: Rising Star Of the year Award
